queries: This is one of the very few true idioms in Auslan. Though some Auslan signers claim this is an old expression, it appears to be borrowed from ASL.
interj: 1. Used in response to someone's request for you to clarify or to repeat something because they  have joined or rejoined a conversation you are having with someone else. It is too late for them to follow because they have missed something vital.
You are not really prepared to repeat yourself. It is used particularly when you have just given the punch-line to a joke and someone does not understand because they were not paying full attention.
